item.title: The Couples Lab
item.description: The Couples Lab The Couples Lab is not actively seeking research assistants Research Projects In the Columbia Couples Lab we study dyadic processes (i.e.Â interactions between two individuals), particularly in health-relevant contexts. Our primary lines of research include how people co-experience stress, how people support each other through adversity, and how people cope with stress (e.g., do they co-ruminate?). We aim to understand how social relationships influence peopleâs functioning, especially during times of stress, as well as how the relationship itself functions during these adverse experiences.
